title: Credit Analyst – Private Debt Fund (BDC) – San Francisco
text:
Login to Start Application 
Well-established and highly regarded public BDC seeks a credit analyst with 18-36 months of experience to manage a portfolio of private debt and equity positions. General responsibilities will include fundamental credit analytics and account monitoring, and analysts will support the transaction structuring and due diligence process. A more detailed inventory of responsibilities includes periodic portfolio review; due diligence and financial modeling for existing and potential transactions; archiving the firm's library of documents for regulatory and audit compliance; portfolio level projects and quarterly performance metrics; interface with third party firms providing valuation, audit, and marketing services to the firm; and, most critically, the analyst will be a source of consistent and accurate information, and will be responsive to other members of the firm. The ideal candidate will have an undergraduate degree from a top-tier institution with distinctive academic performance (cum laude grades) and at least 18 months of experience in accounting, credit analytics or research, and a solid understanding of financial statements and metrics. Additionally, superior communication skills, an obvious strength for managing large quantities of abstract data, the ability to consistently deliver promised results in the face of challenging circumstances, and a commitment to learn and grow professionally. Strong performers will have the opportunity to move onto teams with originations responsibilities after a couple of years. Start Date:
